title: Payment
summary: Cards are widely accepted, but not every global card works equally.
what_to_know: Visa and Mastercard usually work in most chains and larger shops.
why_it_matters: Small places and older kiosks may reject foreign cards without warning.
avoid_this: Do not rely on one card for your full trip.
quick_fix: Carry one backup card and a small amount of cash.

title: Transport
summary: Subway + bus is the easiest way to move fast across neighborhoods.
what_to_know: Buy a transit card once and recharge at convenience stores.
why_it_matters: Transfers are cheaper and smoother with one tap-based card.
avoid_this: Avoid rush hour with luggage when possible.
quick_fix: Travel major moves before 17:30 or after 19:30.

title: Etiquette
summary: Simple social cues keep interactions warm and respectful.
what_to_know: Keep voice low on public transport and queues orderly.
why_it_matters: Small behavior signals strongly affect service tone.
avoid_this: Avoid blocking narrow alleys for photos.
quick_fix: Step aside first, then take your shot.
